title: Error: NG0950: "Input is required but no value is available yet." Give the input name to the error message

labels.name: area: core
labels.description: Issues related to the framework runtime

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

At he moment the error reads as follows:
```
Error: NG0950: Input is required but no value is available yet. Find more at https://angular.dev/errors/NG0950
error properties: Object({ code: -950 })
    at ...
```

### Proposed solution

Just add the input name or its alias to the error message, for example:
```
Error: NG0950: Input ("requiredInputName") is required but no value is available yet. Find more at https://angular.dev/errors/NG0950
error properties: Object({ code: -950 })
    at ...
```

title: bug(devtools): undefined `index` thrown in console once devtools have been opened

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
### Is this a bug report or a feature request?

- [x] Bug Report
- [ ] Feature Request

### Please provide the steps to reproduce the issue [Bug Report only]

Stackblitz on 19.2: https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-88kvgzbs?file=package.json
Example repo on 19.2: https://github.com/michael-small/self-closing-19.2

The error is thrown when opening the devtools extension in a running application, and from experimentation and reading the stacktrace seems to be related to not importing and providing `provideRouter([])` in the application config. 

The Stackblitz starts with it commented out to easily comment back and forth, and the repo can also be toggled to provide routes or not.

This adds up from looking at the provider code in the Stacktrace. Incidentally besides that jumping out, I noticed this because I couldn't get the same error in that repo, like the Stackblitz was throwing. After messing around, I provided the router to the Stackblitz and it stopped throwing. And when I go back and forth between adding and removing that in either application, `provideRouter(routes)]` seems to stop the error.

### Please provide the expected behavior vs the actual behavior you encountered [Bug Report only]

No error thrown

### Please provide a screenshot if possible [Bug Report only]

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fd8461b5-8bf5-41f1-bebe-48e6dc9dcc1e)

### Please provide the exception or error you saw [Bug Report only]

```true
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'index')
    at ds (client-event-subscribers.ts:286:33)
    at ms (client-event-subscribers.ts:302:26)
    at fs (client-event-subscribers.ts:228:19)
    at client-event-subscribers.ts:167:69
    at n (same-page-message-bus.ts:46:21)
```

### Is this a browser-specific issue? If so, please specify the device, browser, and version. [Bug Report only]

```true
Firefox and Chrome both exhibit the same error
```

### Description [Feature Request only]

_No response_

### Proposed solution [Feature Request only]

_No response_

### Alternatives considered [Feature Request only]

_No response_

title: Internal compiler refactors

labels.name: action: review
labels.description: The PR is still awaiting reviews from at least one requested reviewer

labels.name: area: language-service
labels.description: Issues related to Angular's VS Code language service

labels.name: target: patch
labels.description: This PR is targeted for the next patch release

labels.name: area: compiler
labels.description: Issues related to `ngc`, Angular's template compiler

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
Makes the following changes to the compiler to accommodate some future changes:

### refactor(compiler): allow binder to apply to more than one set of nodes 
Currently `R3TargetBinder.bind` gets a set of data back from `DirectiveBinder.apply` and `TemplateBinder.applyWithScope`. This will be annoying  if we have multiple sources of data, because we'd have to do merge them at the end.

These changes switch to constructing the various data structures ahead of time and passing them into the binders to populate them instead.

I also extracted some of the less trivial types into type aliases so we don't have to repeat them.

### refactor(compiler-cli): allow node offsets to be overwritten 

In some cases the offsets produced by `createSourceSpan` might not match the source node exactly (e.g. string literals) so we need to be able to override them.

### refactor(compiler-cli): change TemplateId terminology 

Renames the `TemplateId` and terminology related to it, because we'll be using it for more than just templates.

### refactor(compiler-cli): rework type checking internals to accommodate more than components

Currently a lot of the internal type checking data structures are set up specifically for components, because we only support type checking of templates. Since this will change in future commits, these changes prepare for it by renaming various methods and separating out component-specific data.

### refactor(compiler-cli): rework source manager to accommodate directives 

Currently the `TemplateSourceManager` is set up to specifically cater to component templates. These changes make it more generic so we can reuse it for directives.

### refactor(compiler-cli): rework resource handling to allow directives 

Currently only components can have resources, because they're the only symbol kinds being type checked. Since we want to add directives to it, these changes rework the resource handling to accommodate them.


### refactor(language-service): rename internal symbols to accommodate type checking outside a template

Currently the language service has some template-specific terminology around type checking, because that's the only place where we had TCB support. These changes make it more generic to accommodate future functionality.

title: docs(core): add detailed explanations for async, await, fetch, and then methods
body:
- Added a detailed explanation of the async keyword, noting its use in declaring asynchronous functions for making GET requests over HTTP and its role in non-blocking execution.
- Clarified the function of the await keyword, emphasizing its role in pausing the program until the fetch promise resolves.
- Explained the construction of dynamic URLs within the fetch function using template literals to combine the base URL with a specific id.
- Detailed the use of the .then() method to handle the resolved promise from the getAllHousingLocations() method and ensure subsequent assignments wait for the response.

title: Some component classes come up as undefined/null in test-specs

labels.name: needs reproduction
labels.description: This issue needs a reproduction in order for the team to investigate further

labels.name: area: core
labels.description: Issues related to the framework runtime

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Hello,

with angular 19.1.7 all our Unit-Tests worked fine.
Now with at least angular 19.2.0 (I believe it may also be already broken with 19.1.8 but would have to test this next week seperatly) quite a bunch (all over the board, I could not determine any special things about them) of our tests failed.

The root cause was, that some of our ComponentClasses we created stub instances with, with libs like Sinon or ng-mocks suddenly come up as errors.
A bit of deeper digging resulted in the observation, that not the lib itself was the cause of the error, but that with angular 19.1.7 the inserted SampleComponentClass did what it should do, but in 19.2.0 it suddenly turned up as undefined/not found during test execution.

A sample call would be:
- MockComponent(SampleComponentClass) with ng-mocks or sinon.createStubInstance(SampleComponentClass) with sinon.
- Both calls worked with angular 19.1.7 and stopped working with at least 19.2.0

If there was a breaking change regarding this I missed, I am Sorry.
Or if you need any deeper insights next week on the exact nature of the error please pose some questions, I will try to provide some detailed logs as soon as I can. Nontheless I have to say, I did not managed to get it anymore detailed as I wrote above in one day of digging.

I would be thankful for any help to get this working with the new angular version :)

Thanks in advance

Stefan

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true

```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 19.2.0
NX latest version 20.4.6

Error occured during unit-test execution
```

### Anything else?

_No response_

title: perf(core): avoid marking components for check from signal input changes

labels.name: area: performance
labels.description: Issues related to performance

labels.name: area: core
labels.description: Issues related to the framework runtime

labels.name: target: major
labels.description: This PR is targeted for the next major release

labels.name: requires: TGP
labels.description: This PR requires a passing TGP before merging is allowed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
When signal inputs were introduced, we chose to treat them identically to property inputs for purposes of input setting logic (ngOnChanges, marking for check, ng-reflect, etc). This made sense to ensure switching from `@Input` to `input()` was as seamless and non-breaking as possible.

However, a consequence of this choice is that a property binding to an input signal causes the receiving component to be marked for check even if the input signal is _not_ used in the template directly. For example, it could be used in a `computed` which might not actually change, or it may only be used to drive an `effect`. In those cases, it's unnecessary to check the template at all.

This commit introduces logic to treat input signals differently in the binding path, and avoid marking components for check _purely_ when the input changes. If the input signal is used in the template (either directly or indirectly) the signal change notification will cause the template to be checked via the fast path for signals.

title: HMR not working in lazy loaded modules/components

labels.name: needs reproduction
labels.description: This issue needs a reproduction in order for the team to investigate further

labels.name: area: compiler
labels.description: Issues related to `ngc`, Angular's template compiler

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

HMR works fine for components that are not lazy loaded. Unfortunately when I make changes to lazy loaded components, I see no updates/refreshes.

As soon as I import the lazy modules in app.module.ts, HMR works fine.

Any help/idea would be so appreciated. Let me know if I could share something more specific.

The project I'm working on is 6 years old and I don't discard there might be some misconfiguration being used from older Angular versions. We recently upgraded to Angular 19 and it would be great to have this working.

Thank you!

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
No error. I can see "Component update sent to client(s)." and warning "Component HMR has been enabled.".

For not lazy loaded components, I see a request in Network tab being made and HMR working fine. For lazy loaded ones, I see no request/update.
```

title: template string in interpolation for inline template not highlighting tailwind

labels.name: area: language-service
labels.description: Issues related to Angular's VS Code language service

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? language-service ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description If I use latest template literals in my inline component it not showing the tailwind intenseness to `bg-primary px-4 py-3` but showing for `bg-secondary`. ```html

body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.dev application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

n/a


## What is the new behavior?

This now removes any kind of casting by creating a retrieve wrapper. Note that we still pull out the underlying injector. This is because we need to move some logic out of R3 Injector into inject().  This also keeps things somewhat cleaner since we are just moving stuff around.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
…rror handler

This commit updates error reporting of defer blocks to go to the application root error handler rather than the `ErrorHandler` token that may be provided by users. This ensures Angular has control over what happens when these errors are reported.

title: NgOptimizedImage - NG02952 when unit testing a fill image

labels.name: area: testing
labels.description: Issues related to Angular testing features, such as TestBed

labels.name: area: common
labels.description: Issues related to APIs in the @angular/common package

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core, common ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When unit testing a component that uses a fill image (within a relative parent) a warning is written to console. This doesn't happen when actually running the application. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true 'NG02952: The NgOptimizedImage directive (activated on an element with the `ngSrc="https://placehold.co/259x209"`) has detected that the height of the fill-mode image is zero. This is likely because the containing element does not have the CSS 'position' property set to one of the following: "relative", "fixed", or "absolute". To fix this problem, make sure the container element has the CSS 'position' property defined and the height of the element is not zero.' ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 19.1.7 Node: 22.12.0 Package Manager: npm 10.9.0 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 19.1.6 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server ... router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1901.7 @angular-devkit/build-angular 19.1.7 @angular-devkit/core 19.1.7 @angular-devkit/schematics 19.1.7 @angular/cdk 19.1.4 @angular/cli 19.1.7 @angular/ssr 19.1.7 @schematics/angular 19.1.7 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.7.3 zone.js 0.15.0 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

title: NullInjectorError errors after Angular 19 upgrade

labels.name: needs reproduction
labels.description: This issue needs a reproduction in order for the team to investigate further

labels.name: area: core
labels.description: Issues related to the framework runtime

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core and cdk

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

After upgrading to Angular 19, many of our "Modal" componants throw NullInjectorError errors.
We use ComponentPortals to dynamically create a component and display it as a modal/dialog we also pass in the injector of the "host" component to ensure the modal component has DI access to all the same services as the host.
However this issue is also reproduceable using the Dialog service from the cdk as illustrated in the attached github project.

Our project is very large and we have been slowly transitioning to standalone components, but this is a long process and the majority of the code still uses modules.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/Lightw3ight/ng-19-di-bug

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
module-based-thing.component.html:1 ERROR NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(Environment Injector)[_MyTestService -> _MyTestService]: 
  NullInjectorError: No provider for _MyTestService!
    at <instance_members_initializer> (dynamic-thing.component.ts:10:29)
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 19.1.8
Node: 22.14.0
Package Manager: npm 10.9.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 19.1.7
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1901.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular   19.1.8
@angular-devkit/core            19.1.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      19.1.8
@angular/cdk                    19.1.5
@angular/cli                    19.1.8
@schematics/angular             19.1.8
rxjs                            7.8.2
typescript                      5.7.3
zone.js                         0.15.0
```

### Anything else?

_No response_

title: refactor(core): throw an Cyclic Dependency Error in prod mode

labels.name: action: merge
labels.description: The PR is ready for merge by the caretaker

labels.name: area: core
labels.description: Issues related to the framework runtime

labels.name: target: patch
labels.description: This PR is targeted for the next patch release

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
Prior to this change, cyclic injection didn't trigger any error in prod mode, resulting into injecting the `CIRCULAR` object. This could lead to strange errors where no method would be found on the token.

fixes #60074

There's currently no documentation for event replay. It would be very helpful to have details on what it does, how it works, and what its limitations are.
